articles.title: Phase I randomized double-blind parallel-group study: pharmacokinetics, safety, and immunogenicity of pertuzumab biosimilar SYSA1901 in healthy Chinese males.
articles.summary: A biosimilar version of pertuzumab (SYSA1901) demonstrated comparable pharmacokinetics, safety, and immunogenicity to the reference drug Perjeta® in healthy Chinese males.

articles.title: Pelvic Floor Dysfunction Following Gynecologic Cancer Surgery and Adjuvant Therapy: Epidemiology, Mechanisms, and Management-A Systematic Review.
articles.summary: Gynecologic cancer treatments can significantly disrupt pelvic floor function, requiring comprehensive rehabilitation and multidisciplinary approaches to manage patient symptoms and improve quality of life.

articles.title: Recent advances in bispecific antibody-drug conjugates for breast cancer therapy.
articles.summary: Researchers are developing new targeted breast cancer treatments using bispecific antibody-drug conjugates to more precisely attack cancer cells.

articles.title: Delphi panel consensus on genetic testing for prostate cancer in Australia: Whom to test and how?
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary in under 25 words:

Australian experts recommend genetic testing for prostate cancer patients with high-risk family histories, focusing on specific hereditary gene mutations.

articles.title: A comparative assessment of radiochemical purity and yield of [18F]PSMA-1007 production using two different automated synthesis platforms: a head-to-head comparison.
articles.summary: Researchers compared two automated methods for producing a promising PET imaging tracer for prostate cancer, ensuring its quality and reliability for clinical use.

articles.title: YTHDC1 Inhibits Esophageal Cancer Cell Apoptosis, Radiosensitivity and Autophagy Via Upregulating PLK1 by Stabilizing USP10.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear summary sentence:

YTHDC1 protein promotes esophageal cancer cell survival and resistance to radiation by stabilizing USP10 and increasing PLK1 levels.

articles.title: Whole-Exome Profiling of Epstein-Barr Virus-Positive Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Nasopharynx.
articles.summary: Whole-exome sequencing of rare Epstein-Barr virus-positive nasopharyngeal neuroendocrine carcinoma revealed distinct genetic mutations and potential targeted therapy options.

articles.title: Circulating tumor DNA methylation and gut microbiota in colorectal cancer: diagnostic, prognostic, and therapeutic implications.
articles.summary: Circulating tumor DNA methylation and gut microbiota analysis could improve early detection, treatment monitoring, and personalized management of colorectal cancer.

articles.title: Breast cancer frontiers: mapping molecular signals, intelligent diagnostics, and adaptive therapies.
articles.summary: Researchers are using multi-omics technologies, AI, and advanced therapies to develop personalized breast cancer treatments that improve precision and patient outcomes.

articles.title: Early-onset colorectal cancer is associated with metabolic disorders: a systematic review and meta-analysis.
articles.summary: Early-onset colorectal cancer risk increases significantly with obesity, diabetes, and metabolic disorders in individuals under 50 years old.

articles.title: Clinical and Humanistic Burden Among Adults with Neurofibromatosis Type 1 and Symptomatic Plexiform Neurofibroma in the United States.
articles.summary: Researchers found that adults with neurofibromatosis type 1 and plexiform neurofibromas experience significant impacts on quality of life and clinical health.

articles.title: The importance of targeted plus perilesional prostate biopsy in prostate cancer management (diagnosis and treatment)-real world evidence of a tertiary centre.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

Targeted prostate biopsies with additional perilesional sampling can more accurately detect clinically significant prostate cancer compared to standard systematic biopsy techniques.

articles.title: Evaluation of Inflammatory Parameters and Ferritin as Prognostic Factors in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Patients Receiving Nivolumab Immunotherapy.
articles.summary: In NSCLC patients receiving nivolumab, lower prognostic inflammatory nutritional index (PNI) was associated with significantly shorter overall and progression-free survival.

articles.title: Identification of LGR5 and TFF2 as Biomarkers in High-Risk Chronic Atrophic Gastritis: From Multi-Omics Mining to Clinical Validation.
articles.summary: LGR5 and TFF2 biomarkers reveal key molecular mechanisms in chronic atrophic gastritis that could help predict gastric cancer risk.

articles.title: Bradyzoite subtypes rule the crossroads of Toxoplasma development.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered multiple distinct bradyzoite subtypes within Toxoplasma cysts, revealing complex developmental pathways that could inform future treatment strategies.

articles.title: Click-based determination of accumulation of molecules in Escherichia coli.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a rapid, high-throughput method (CHAMP assay) to measure how small molecules penetrate and accumulate in E. coli bacteria, potentially advancing drug development against bacterial infections.

articles.title: Preclinical profiling of antibody drug conjugates targeting oncofetal chondroitin sulfate.
articles.summary: Vartumab antibody drug conjugates targeting oncofetal chondroitin sulfate effectively kill cancer cells and surrounding tumor tissue in preclinical melanoma models.

articles.title: Ultrasensitive ctDNA monitoring reveals early predictors of immunotherapy response in advanced cancer.
articles.summary: A high-sensitivity ctDNA test can predict immunotherapy response in advanced cancer patients by detecting early molecular changes in blood.

articles.title: An integrative approach to identify novel miRNA-mRNA interaction networks in LMNA-cardiomyopathy.
articles.summary: Researchers identified key genetic interactions in LMNA-related dilated cardiomyopathy, revealing 2,197 miRNA-target gene pairs that could explain disease progression.

articles.title: Research on the molecular mechanism of celastrol targeting CTNNB1/STAT3 to inhibit uveal melanoma based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Celastrol inhibits uveal melanoma by targeting CTNNB1 and STAT3 proteins, suppressing tumor cell growth, migration, and promoting cancer cell death.

articles.title: Single amino-acid differences define H2B variants and modify chromatin accessibility to induce EMT in breast cancer.
articles.summary: In breast cancer, the H2B1O histone variant compacts chromatin, activates oncogenic pathways, and promotes tumor progression and chemotherapy resistance.

articles.title: CISH, a key intracellular checkpoint, in comparison and combination to existing and emerging cancer immune checkpoints.
articles.summary: CISH gene deletion in T cells significantly enhances cancer-fighting ability by improving tumor antigen recognition and killing across different cancer types.

articles.title: A single-cell derived spheroid approach to dissect intratumoural heterogeneity in colorectal cancer: cell lines show changes in proteomes and therapeutic response to 5-FU.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a new method using single-cell spheroids to better understand and analyze the diverse cell populations within colorectal cancer tumors.

articles.title: CARM1-mediated hypoxanthine-enriched exosomes rewire inosine metabolism and impair CD8+ T cell antitumor function.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

In breast cancer, CARM1-mediated exosomes containing hypoxanthine disrupt T cell metabolism, suppressing their ability to fight tumors.

articles.title: Exploring translational relevance of baseline and longitudinal metabolic profiling in the blood of ovarian cancer patients.
articles.summary: A metabolic blood signature using acetoacetate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, and alanine could predict ovarian cancer patient outcomes and relapse risk.

articles.title: Comparative evaluation of HTG and TempO Seq targeted transcriptome profiling methods.
articles.summary: Researchers compared two targeted RNA sequencing methods for analyzing gene expression in endometrial cancer samples, finding TempO-Seq can effectively replace the discontinued HTG platform.

articles.title: Machine learning-based models for preoperative prediction of pituitary adenoma consistency: a systematic review and meta-analysis.
articles.summary: Machine learning models can now accurately predict the surgical difficulty of pituitary tumors by analyzing pre-operative MRI scans, potentially improving surgical planning.

articles.title: Consensus-based computational mapping of NS1 antigenic determinants in dengue and Zika viruses to improve diagnostic specificity.
articles.summary: Researchers mapped specific protein regions in dengue and Zika viruses to improve diagnostic accuracy and reduce cross-reactivity in antibody testing.

articles.title: Inhibition of the RORC/GPX4 mediated ferroptosis regulatory axis suppresses tumor growth and alleviates enzalutamide resistance in prostate cancer.
articles.summary: Ilicicolin A inhibits a specific cellular pathway in prostate cancer, potentially overcoming drug resistance and reducing tumor growth.

articles.title: ProteoBoostR: an interactive framework for supervised machine learning in clinical proteomics.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

ProteoBoostR provides a user-friendly machine learning tool to help researchers more easily analyze protein data for potential cancer classification.

articles.title: Exploring the link between Mycobacterium avium subsp. Paratuberculosis and colorectal cancer development.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence focusing on the key finding:

Research suggests that Mycobacterium avium bacteria from infected livestock may increase inflammation and potentially contribute to colorectal cancer risk.

articles.title: CT-based radiomics nomogram for preoperative prediction of Ki-67 in lung neuroendocrine neoplasms: a multicenter study.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a CT scan-based tool that can predict the proliferation rate of lung neuroendocrine tumors without invasive biopsy.

articles.title: Polycythemia vera and stiff-person syndrome: a case report.
articles.summary: A rare case report explores the potential connection between polycythemia vera, a blood disorder, and stiff-person syndrome, an autoimmune neurological condition.

articles.title: Local metastatic expansion versus secondary intra-organ dissemination: two causes of neurological death explained by fundamentally different metastatic colonization patterns.
articles.summary: The research reveals two distinct metastasis patterns in brain cancer that can lead to neurological death through different mechanisms of tumor spread.

articles.title: Potential oncogene VPS72 in hepatocellular carcinoma: prognostic and immune infiltration implications.
articles.summary: VPS72 gene potentially influences hepatocellular carcinoma progression by modulating immune cell infiltration and could serve as a future diagnostic or prognostic marker.

articles.title: Single-cell transcriptomics uncover RNF130-mediated TNF-α pathway activation and worenine synergy with paclitaxel in breast cancer.
articles.summary: In triple-negative breast cancer, RNF130 influences TNF-α pathways, and worenine combined with paclitaxel shows potential for improving treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: HMGB1 affects the progression of neurofibromatosis type 1-associated malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors through E2F2.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

HMGB1 protein influences the progression of nerve sheath tumors in neurofibromatosis type 1, potentially offering new insights for treatment.

articles.title: The predictive value of glycated albumin and hemoglobin A1c for all-cause and cardiovascular mortality in chronic kidney disease patients.
articles.summary: In CKD patients, glycated albumin may be a more reliable predictor of mortality risk than traditional hemoglobin A1c measurements.

articles.title: IL-2 Free Expansion of T Cells with Immunofilaments.
articles.summary: Immunofilaments with precisely engineered antibody ratios can effectively expand T cells for cancer immunotherapy without IL-2 supplementation, potentially improving cell therapy approaches.

articles.title: Neoadjuvant therapy in skin cancer: current evidence and future perspectives.
articles.summary: Neoadjuvant immunotherapies and targeted treatments show promising results in reducing recurrence and improving outcomes for locally advanced skin cancers like melanoma and squamous cell carcinoma.

articles.title: PPh2Me-Promoted [4 + 3] Annulation for Synthesis of Quinazoline-Fused Benzothiadiazepines as Anti-Breast Cancer Agents.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a new synthetic method to create quinazoline-fused benzothiadiazepines that show promising anti-triple negative breast cancer activity by potentially targeting EGFR kinase.

articles.title: Programming the Optoelectronic Properties of Atomically Precise Gold Nanoclusters Using the Conformational Landscape of Intrinsically Disordered Proteins.
articles.summary: Researchers used flexible proteins to precisely control gold nanoclusters' light-emitting properties, achieving significant enhancement in near-infrared photoluminescence through targeted protein engineering.

articles.title: Targeting ZDHHC12-mediated PARP1 palmitoylation potentiates PARP inhibitor cytotoxicity.
articles.summary: In high-grade ovarian cancer, inhibiting the enzyme ZDHHC12 can increase PARP1 protein trapping and improve response to PARP inhibitor drugs.

articles.title: FAST: Scalable Factor Analysis for Spatial Dimension Reduction of Multi-section Spatial Transcriptomics.
articles.summary: FAST is a new computational method that efficiently analyzes spatial gene expression data across multiple tissue sections, revealing insights into cell types and cancer-related gene activity.

articles.title: Identifying expression and DNA methylation biomarkers for lung adenocarcinoma risk in East Asia.
articles.summary: Researchers identified 28 genetic variants linked to lung adenocarcinoma risk in East Asian populations, revealing two genes associated with cancer susceptibility.

articles.title: Perioperative chemoimmunotherapy for patients with gastric or gastroesophageal junction cancer: a systematic review and meta-analysis.
articles.summary: Adding immune checkpoint inhibitors to standard chemotherapy before and after surgery may improve survival for patients with gastric or gastroesophageal junction cancer.

articles.title: IL-6 blockade at the fracture site accelerates bone healing via inflammatory modulation of sensory nerve CGRP signaling.
articles.summary: Blocking IL-6 at a fracture site can improve bone healing by modifying nerve signaling and reducing inflammation in femoral fractures.

articles.title: Utilization of machine learning algorithms for the identification of the RLN associated prognostic model and feature biomarkers of RLN-related subtypes in breast cancer.
articles.summary: Researchers used machine learning to identify specific gene markers and immune system interactions related to relaxin genes that could help predict breast cancer progression.

articles.title: A phase I/IIa study of auceliciclib in patients with advanced solid tumours and in combination with temozolomide in patients with recurrent/relapsed high-grade glioma.
articles.summary: Researchers tested a new drug auceliciclib in patients with advanced solid tumors and high-grade glioma, showing promising early results for potential cancer treatment.

articles.title: A literature review on hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis dysregulation in older adults with cancer: A missing link in predicting treatment toxicity?
articles.summary: The research suggests that age-related changes in stress hormones may predict treatment toxicity risks in older cancer patients, highlighting the need for personalized risk assessment.

articles.title: Dual-Mode Ventilation Promotes Diaphragm Function Recovery in Rats With Ventilator-Induced Diaphragmatic Dysfunction by Upregulating Insulin-Like Growth Factor-1.
articles.summary: Dual-mode ventilation helps restore diaphragm function in rats by increasing insulin-like growth factor-1, potentially improving recovery from ventilator-induced muscle weakness.

articles.title: Effect of radiation dosage to vital ocular structures on visual outcomes: Re-evaluation for the future.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Researchers investigated optimal radiation levels for preserving vision in patients with uveal melanoma during eye cancer treatment.

articles.title: Alkyne modification of DNA cross-linking antitumor agent SJG-136 to monitor induced lesions in cells by click chemistry.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a modified DNA-damaging cancer drug with an alkyne tag that allows direct visualization of its cellular damage using fluorescence techniques.

articles.title: Evolution and trends in non-viral mRNA Cancer vaccines: A scoping review from 2015 to 2025.
articles.summary: mRNA cancer vaccines are shifting from dendritic cell-based to lipid nanoparticle delivery, with promising potential for combination immunotherapies across multiple cancer types.

articles.title: Real-world utilization and potential clinical and economic value of recombinant zoster vaccine and select preventive services recommended for older adults in the United States.
articles.summary: A study found that older adults in the US often underutilize recommended preventive services, including the recombinant zoster vaccine for shingles prevention.

articles.title: Casticin in cancer research: in vitro evidence and mechanistic insights into its antitumor potential.
articles.summary: Casticin, a natural flavonoid, shows promising anticancer effects by inhibiting cell growth and triggering multiple cell death mechanisms across various cancer cell lines.

articles.title: Pachymic acid suppresses proliferation and invasion in colon cancer by inhibiting glycolysis via PPARγ/ENO1 pathway.
articles.summary: Pachymic acid from Poria cocos suppresses colon cancer cell growth and spread by disrupting cellular energy metabolism through the PPARγ pathway.

articles.title: Structure-activity relationships reveal a 4-(2-pyridyl)chalcone as a potent cell death inducer.
articles.summary: A specific chalcone (BHP) effectively induced cell death in leukemia cells by triggering mitochondrial apoptosis with low toxicity to healthy cells.

articles.title: Celastrol induces cardiotoxicity by directly targeting AMOTL2 and inhibiting YAP1/PGC-1α/TFAM-dependent mitochondrial biogenesis.
articles.summary: Celastrol triggers heart damage by disrupting a key protein (AMOTL2), which impairs mitochondrial function and promotes cell death in cardiac tissue.

articles.title: Kaempferol suppresses prostate cancer metastasis and tumor angiogenesis via disrupting the LIMK1/Cofilin pathway.
articles.summary: Kaempferol, a plant compound, suppresses prostate cancer metastasis by disrupting the LIMK1/Cofilin pathway, inhibiting tumor growth and angiogenesis.

articles.title: TPI1 promotes tumor progression and M2 macrophage polarization: Integrated pan-cancer and lung adenocarcinoma insights.
articles.summary: TPI1 promotes lung adenocarcinoma progression by enhancing tumor cell growth and driving immunosuppressive macrophage changes, suggesting potential therapeutic targeting.

articles.title: Analysis of cuproptosis-related genes in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma based on bioinformatics and experimental validation.
articles.summary: Researchers identified specific genes linked to cuproptosis that may play a critical role in understanding and potentially treating head and neck cancer progression.

articles.title: Targeting Sestrin2 impairs survival of senescent cancer cells following DNA-damaging therapies.
articles.summary: Targeting Sestrin2 selectively kills senescent cancer cells after DNA-damaging therapies, potentially improving treatment effectiveness by preventing cancer relapse.

articles.title: HER3 enhances ATF4 induction and survival in breast cancer cells during endoplasmic reticulum stress.
articles.summary: HER3 promotes breast cancer cell survival during stress by enhancing ATF4 production, potentially protecting cells from death-inducing conditions.

articles.title: SLC16A3 as a novel therapeutic target for overcoming radioresistance and chemoresistance in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Targeting SLC16A3 in lung cancer may enhance radiation and chemotherapy effectiveness by promoting cancer cell death through the p38 pathway.

articles.title: Comprehensive pharmacological insights into Glaucocalyxin A: Mechanisms and therapeutic potential.
articles.summary: Glaucocalyxin A, a natural compound from Rabdosia japonica, shows potential anti-tumor effects by targeting key molecular pathways in cancer cells.

articles.title: Unraveling the molecular mechanisms of air pollution-induced lung adenocarcinoma through machine learning, network toxicology, and molecular docking.
articles.summary: Machine learning revealed how air pollution triggers lung adenocarcinoma by identifying key molecular interactions and potential therapeutic targets.

articles.title: [Precision surgical treatment for middle and low rectal cancer in the era of artificial intelligence].
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

AI-enhanced imaging and surgical techniques enable more precise, personalized treatment strategies for middle and low rectal cancer, improving patient outcomes.

articles.title: [Artificial intelligence prediction of surgical difficulty in mid-low rectal cancer: a single-center cohort study].
articles.summary: An AI-powered machine learning model can predict surgical difficulty for mid-low rectal cancer patients with 83% accuracy, helping surgeons select the most appropriate surgical approach.

articles.title: [Incidence and clinical characteristics of transmural colitis after concurrent preventive ostomy in radical rectal cancer surgery].
articles.summary: In rectal cancer surgery with ileostomy, diversion colitis occurs in 100% of patients, with severe cases linked to longer stoma closure and poorer bowel function.

articles.title: [Preliminary application of linear stapler-assisted en bloc resection of lateral pelvic sidewall for locally advanced rectal cancer and locally recurrent rectal cancer with significant pelvic occupation].
articles.summary: A linear stapler-assisted surgical technique for advanced or recurrent rectal cancer successfully removed extensive pelvic tumors with minimal blood loss and mostly complete tumor removal.

articles.title: [Exosomes in acupoint area involved in the effect of electroacupuncture on muscle regeneration and repair in rats with multifidus muscle injury].
articles.summary: Electroacupuncture enhanced muscle regeneration in rats with muscle injury by influencing key muscle repair proteins and exosome-related markers.

articles.title: [Study on the underlying mechanism of acupotomy in inhibiting bone destruction in collagen-induced arthritis rats based on OPG/RANKL/NF-κB signaling pathway].
articles.summary: Acupotomy treatment reduced bone damage in rheumatoid arthritis by disrupting a key inflammatory signaling pathway that promotes bone breakdown.

articles.title: [Mechanisms of electroacupuncture at Foot Shaoyang meridian acupoints on inflammatory response in postmenopausal osteoporosis rats based on the PI3K/AKT signaling pathway].
articles.summary: Electroacupuncture at specific acupoints reduced inflammation in postmenopausal osteoporosis by modulating a key cellular signaling pathway.

articles.title: Stool DNA-based SDC2 Methylation Test for the Screening of Colorectal Neoplasia in an Asymptomatic, Average-Risk Population.
articles.summary: A stool DNA test detecting Syndecan-2 methylation shows promise as a non-invasive screening method for colorectal cancer in average-risk individuals.

articles.title: Isolated Neurofibroma of the Gallbladder and Common Bile Duct Mimicking Malignancy: A Rare Case Report and Review of Literature.
articles.summary: A rare case revealed a benign neurofibroma in the gallbladder and bile duct, which initially appeared to be cancer, avoiding unnecessary extensive surgery.

articles.title: Alcohol induces sorafenib resistance in hepatocellular carcinoma: A translational study.
articles.summary: Chronic alcohol exposure reduces sorafenib's effectiveness in hepatocellular carcinoma, leading to increased drug resistance and worse patient survival.

articles.title: Spatial Profiling Reveals Distinct Molecular and Immune Evolution of Mouse Lung Adenocarcinoma Precancers with or Without Carcinogen Exposure.
articles.summary: In lung adenocarcinoma mouse models, carcinogen exposure increased mutational burden, altered immune cell dynamics, and revealed distinct tumor evolution patterns.

articles.title: p16Ink4a-Positive Hepatocytes Drive Liver Fibrosis Through Activation of LIFR Family Pathway.
articles.summary: In liver fibrosis, aged hepatocytes with high p16Ink4a levels drive disease progression by activating the LIFR signaling pathway, suggesting a potential therapeutic target.

articles.title: Impact of Early-Line Systemic Therapies on Liver Function in Hepatocellular Carcinoma: Longitudinal Change of ALBI Score and Ammonia Level With and Without Anti-VEGF Agents.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Anti-VEGF therapy for liver cancer may negatively impact liver function, potentially compromising patients' hepatic regeneration and overall treatment response.

articles.title: The Shell Thickness of Polydopamine Nanocapsules Influences Protein Adsorption and Cellular Uptake.
articles.summary: Polydopamine nanocapsules with thinner shells adsorb more proteins and show higher cellular uptake in breast cancer and other cell lines.

articles.title: Safety and effectiveness of selpercatinib in patients with RET fusion-positive non-small cell lung cancer in real-world clinical practice: a postmarketing study in Japan.
articles.summary: Selpercatinib showed promising safety and effectiveness for patients with RET fusion-positive lung cancer in a real-world Japanese clinical study.

articles.title: Enzyme-Activated Programmable Theranostic Platform for Spatiotemporal Imaging of Intracellular MicroRNA and On-Demand Manipulation-Mediated Therapy.
articles.summary: A Ce-MOF/DNA platform detects high miRNA-21 levels in tumor cells, enables real-time imaging, and suppresses tumor growth by targeting the oncogenic microRNA.

articles.title: Gastroduodenal Intussusception With Gastric Outlet Obstruction and Periampullary Compression Due to a Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor in the Stomach.
articles.summary: A rare case study describes a gastric stromal tumor causing intestinal blockage, bile duct compression, and pancreatitis, successfully treated through surgical removal.

articles.title: Intrachromosomal insertion as a diagnostic challenge: a hidden structural rearrangement causing recurrent duplication and deletion.
articles.summary: Advanced genetic testing revealed a complex chromosomal rearrangement that can cause unexpected genetic changes and potential reproductive risks.

articles.title: Targeting the Akt-EphA2 axis and cell-cell adhesion enhances anoikis sensitivity in cancer cells.
articles.summary: Targeting Akt, EphA2, and ICAM1 can enhance breast cancer cell death when detached from the matrix, even after restoring rigidity sensing.

articles.title: The Current Status of Radionuclide Tumor Targeting Diagnosis and Therapy Based on FAP-2286: From Preclinical Studies to Clinical Application.
articles.summary: FAP-2286, a targeted radiopharmaceutical, shows promise for both imaging and treating various cancers by specifically binding to tumor-associated fibroblasts.

articles.title: Ultrasound-assisted extraction of endemic Stachys antalyensis: LC-ESI-MS/MS phenolic profiling and in vitro antioxidant, enzyme-inhibitory, and cytotoxicity evaluation.
articles.summary: Stachys antalyensis methanolic extract demonstrated potent antioxidant properties and low toxicity, showing promise as a potential natural compound for biomedical applications.

articles.title: Novel Tetrahydroxanthylium-Based Ligands Targeting Mitochondrial DNA G-Quadruplex Structures for Concurrent Induction of Apoptosis and Inhibition of Autophagy in Liver Cancer.
articles.summary: A novel compound XAN-5 targets mitochondrial DNA structures in liver cancer, simultaneously triggering cancer cell death and blocking survival mechanisms.

articles.title: Comprehensive Curation and Harmonization of Small-Molecule MS/MS Libraries in Spectraverse.
articles.summary: Spectraverse creates a comprehensive, cleaned library of small molecule mass spectrometry data to improve metabolite identification and machine learning model training.

articles.title: The 'Comparison of diagnostic accuracy of Luminal Index and standard of care MRI for Accelerated deTEction of prostate cancer' (CLIMATE) trial protocol.
articles.summary: The CLIMATE trial will compare a new, faster MRI technique (Luminal Index) with standard MRI to detect clinically significant prostate cancer more efficiently.

articles.title: Deciphering the Atomic Mechanisms of Third-Generation Bisteric mTOR Inhibitors through Comparative Microsecond Molecular Dynamics Simulations.
articles.summary: Molecular dynamics simulations reveal how third-generation mTOR inhibitors with optimal linker lengths can more effectively block cancer cell growth by stabilizing the protein's catalytic site.

articles.title: Structure-Based Virtual Screening Discovers Potent PLK1 Inhibitors with Anticancer Activity.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered two potent PLK1 inhibitors through computational screening that showed strong anticancer activity and effectively stopped cell growth in multiple cancer cell lines.

articles.title: Toward In Situ Dynamics of DNA-Bound Full-Length p53 Tetramer.
articles.summary: Molecular simulations revealed how wild-type p53 protein interacts with DNA and how cancer mutations disrupt its normal structural dynamics and tumor-suppressing function.

articles.title: Lactobacillus fermentum remodeled the lung microbiota by crosstalk with the gut and lungs and regulated the PI3K-AKT pathway to alleviate acute lung injury.
articles.summary: Lactobacillus fermentum reduces lung inflammation by modulating gut-lung interactions and suppressing a key inflammatory pathway in acute lung injury.

articles.title: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene suppresses prostate cancer via apoptosis and autophagy in vitro and potent tumor growth inhibition in vivo.
articles.summary: A natural compound derived from plants, 3'-hydroxypterostilbene, significantly reduced prostate cancer cell growth by triggering cell death through multiple mechanisms.

articles.title: Summary and Analysis of Molecular Biological Changes, PD-L1 Immune Status and Clinicopathological Features of 78 Cases of Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma (<1 cm in Diameter) Combined With Lateral Cervical Lymph Node Metastasis.
articles.summary: In small papillary thyroid carcinomas with lymph node metastasis, gene mutations and PD-L1 expression suggest potential targeted immunotherapy for females.

articles.title: Preliminary assessment of an MRI-based grading system for leptomeningeal disease: an exploratory prognostic framework.
articles.summary: A new MRI-based grading system could improve diagnosis and prognosis of leptomeningeal disease without invasive procedures.

articles.title: B-cell marker expression in acute myeloid leukemia with plasmacytoid dendritic cell differentiation (pDC-AML) without RUNX1 lesions: An underrecognized diagnostic pitfall.
articles.summary: In two cases of plasmacytoid dendritic cell acute myeloid leukemia, B-cell marker expression occurred without RUNX1 genetic changes, suggesting an intrinsic pDC characteristic.

articles.title: High levels of circulating miR-19a-3p in patients with metastatic HER2 + breast cancer are associated with a favorable prognosis and anti-tumor immune responses.
articles.summary: In HER2+ breast cancer, higher levels of miR-19a-3p in the blood are linked to better prognosis and enhanced anti-tumor immune responses.

articles.title: Risk of bone fractures in patients with prostate cancer treated with maximal androgen blockade therapy: a systematic literature review and meta-analysis.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Prostate cancer patients on maximal androgen blockade therapy have an increased risk of bone fractures compared to those on standard androgen deprivation therapy.

articles.title: Ensemble-learning-assisted exhaled gas disease analysis based on in-situ construction of MOF-derived MOx/GaN heterojunction sensor arrays.
articles.summary: A novel nanoscale sensor array using AI-assisted technology can detect lung cancer with 95.8% accuracy by analyzing exhaled breath at room temperature.

articles.title: Clonal determinants of organotropism and survival in metastatic uveal melanoma.
articles.summary: In uveal melanoma, BAP1-mutant tumor cells with monosomy 3 preferentially spread to the liver, associated with worse patient survival.

articles.title: Metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease and steatohepatitis-associated hepatocarcinoma preclinical models.
articles.summary: Researchers review preclinical models for liver disease progression, emphasizing the need for experimental designs that accurately simulate metabolic liver disease and hepatocellular cancer development.

articles.title: Rapid and ultra-low detection of cancer biomarker miRNA-133a-3p via AC electrokinetics-integrated capacitive sensing.
articles.summary: A novel sensor using gold electrodes and alternating current can detect extremely low levels of miRNA-133a-3p, a cancer biomarker, with high sensitivity in serum.

articles.title: Plasma Proteomic Signatures of Physical Activity Provide Insights into Biological Impacts and Its Protective Role Against Dementia.
articles.summary: Physical activity appears to protect against dementia by positively altering specific proteins in the blood that support brain health and reduce disease risk.

articles.title: [Evaluation of long-term prognosis of gastric cancer patients by tumor textbook outcome and analysis of related factors].
articles.summary: In patients with gastric cancer, achieving textbook oncologic outcome after surgery is associated with significantly better long-term survival rates.

articles.title: [The function and application of nucleolar small RNAs in digestive tract tumors].
articles.summary: SnoRNAs are abnormally expressed in digestive tract cancers and play a critical role in promoting tumor growth and progression through multiple biological mechanisms.

articles.title: Aspirin and Atorvastatin Augmentation Treatment in Patients with Major Affective Disorders and Inflammatory Dysregulation: A 12-Week Randomized Placebo-Controlled Study.
articles.summary: In patients with major affective disorders, combining aspirin and atorvastatin showed potential to enhance antidepressant treatment by addressing underlying inflammatory processes.

articles.title: Epidemiological characteristics of severe skin adverse reactions caused by immune checkpoint inhibitors based on case reports.
articles.summary: A comprehensive review found that immune checkpoint inhibitor cancer treatments can cause serious skin reactions, highlighting the need for careful patient monitoring.

articles.title: Therapeutic potential of MSCs and their exosomes in hepatic Ischaemia-Reperfusion injury: a systematic review and meta-analysis of rodent studies.
articles.summary: Mesenchymal stem cells and their exosomes show promise in reducing liver damage caused by ischemia-reperfusion injury in rodent studies, suggesting potential therapeutic benefits.

articles.title: Genomic Characterization of Oncocytic Carcinoma of the Thyroid Using a Large Multi-Institutional Database.
articles.summary: Multi-institutional genomic analysis of thyroid oncocytic carcinoma revealed unique mutation patterns that could inform potential targeted treatment strategies for this rare cancer.

articles.title: Molecular basis for targeting caveolin-1 in multiple myeloma therapy.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Targeting caveolin-1 protein could potentially improve treatment options for multiple myeloma by disrupting cancer cell signaling and metabolism.

articles.title: Inhibition of Cxcr4 chemokine receptor signaling improves habituation learning in a zebrafish model of Neurofibromatosis.
articles.summary: Inhibiting the Cxcr4 receptor with Plerixafor improves learning difficulties in a zebrafish model of Neurofibromatosis type 1.

articles.title: A National Analysis of Microscopic Positive Margins in Oropharyngeal Cancer Patients Undergoing Transoral Robotic Surgery.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Researchers found that microscopic positive margins in robotic surgery for oropharyngeal cancer impact treatment decisions and patient survival outcomes.

articles.title: Protective effect of Rosmarinus officinalis and its nanoparticles against chemobrain and neuroinflammation in rats: involvement of Wnt/β-catenin signaling and apoptotic machineries.
articles.summary: Rosmarinus officinalis extract and nanoemulsion protected against oxaliplatin-induced cognitive impairment in rats by reducing neuroinflammation and preserving hippocampal structure.

articles.title: Seated Saline Suppression Test for Lateralizing Primary Aldosteronism.
articles.summary: Since the details about the specific cancer research are not clear from the title and abstract, I cannot confidently create a summary sentence. The text appears to describe a medical diagnostic test for primary aldosteronism, which is a hormonal disorder, not a cancer research study. Would you like me to clarify the source material or research details?

articles.title: Bio-reductive hetero-bimetallic Co(iii)-Pt(ii) complex for tumor-selective platinum release and cytotoxicity.
articles.summary: A novel Co(iii)-Pt(ii) complex selectively targets lung and breast cancer cells by releasing platinum in the tumor's unique reductive environment.

articles.title: Angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma with lymphomatous effusion: Diagnostic challenges and cytology-based approaches.
articles.summary: A diagnostic approach using cytology, immunocytochemistry, and molecular testing can help identify aggressive angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma in low-volume body fluid samples.

articles.title: Ectopic expression of BEX genes in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia.
articles.summary: BEX genes are abnormally expressed in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia, potentially contributing to cancer progression through interactions with the TAL1 oncogene.

articles.title: Fecal leukocyte esterase levels predict endoscopic severity as an alternative biomarker in inflammatory bowel disease.
articles.summary: Fecal leukocyte esterase levels could serve as a reliable marker for gauging inflammation severity in inflammatory bowel disease.

articles.title: Impact of renal and hepatic function on dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase phenotype assessed by enzyme activity in peripheral blood mononuclear cells and uracilemia.
articles.summary: Researchers examined how kidney and liver function affect an enzyme's activity related to processing certain cancer drugs and metabolites.

articles.title: CA-125 glycovariant assays enhance diagnostic sensitivity in the detection of epithelial ovarian cancer.
articles.summary: New glycosylation-based CA-125 blood tests show promise for detecting epithelial ovarian cancer earlier and more accurately than previous screening methods.

articles.title: Ablation of CD38 in multiple myeloma cells leads to an aggressive phenotype in a mouse xenograft model.
articles.summary: Losing CD38 in multiple myeloma cells increases tumor aggressiveness, causing more bone damage, metastasis, and shorter survival in mouse models.

articles.title: Cabozantinib and thromboembolism in patients with cancer: a systematic review, meta-analysis, and retrospective study.
articles.summary: Cabozantinib, a cancer treatment drug, significantly increases venous thromboembolism risk in cancer patients, particularly during the first three months of treatment.

articles.title: Late failure of aggressive B-cell lymphoma after CAR T-cell therapy: a LYSA study from the DESCAR-T registry.
articles.summary: Bispecific antibodies showed promising outcomes for large B-cell lymphoma patients experiencing late failure after CAR T-cell therapy, with better progression-free survival compared to other treatments.

articles.title: Central nervous system involvement in CLL: an international retrospective study by ERIC, the European Research Initiative on CLL.
articles.summary: In a multinational study, CLL patients with central nervous system involvement showed high treatment response rates and improved survival when treated with targeted therapies.

articles.title: Optical genome mapping in myelofibrosis: enhancing prognostic accuracy through high-resolution genomic profiling.
articles.summary: Optical genome mapping significantly improved risk assessment for myelofibrosis patients by revealing complex genetic alterations missed by conventional chromosome analysis.

articles.title: Long-term follow-up of zevor-cel in patients with relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma.
articles.summary: Zevor-cel CAR T-cell therapy showed 100% response rate and promising long-term survival in heavily pretreated multiple myeloma patients, with manageable side effects.

articles.title: Clinical Implications of Aberrant Retinoblastoma Signaling in Patients With Grade 4 IDH-Mutant Astrocytoma: A Retrospective Cohort Study.
articles.summary: Researchers found that disrupted retinoblastoma signaling in grade 4 IDH-mutant astrocytoma brain tumors is associated with patient survival outcomes.

articles.title: Memory Deficits in Cancer Patients With Serum NMDA Receptor Autoantibodies.
articles.summary: Cancer patients with NMDA receptor autoantibodies showed significant memory deficits compared to matched controls, suggesting these antibodies may contribute to cognitive impairment.

articles.title: NF1-Specific Growth Charts for Head Circumference Over the First 3 Years of Life.
articles.summary: Researchers developed specialized growth charts for head size in children with neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1) to better track head growth during the first three years of life.

articles.title: Functionally heterogeneous intratumoral CD4+CD8+ double-positive T cells can give rise to single-positive T cells.
articles.summary: In renal cell carcinoma, double-positive T cells can transform into single-positive T cells, potentially playing a unique role in tumor immunity.

articles.title: Bioresponsive immunomodulator nanocomplex for selective immunoengineering in metastatic lymph nodes.
articles.summary: A nanocomplex targeting lymph node metastasis selectively delivers immunotherapy, activating T-cell responses and inhibiting tumor growth in mouse models.

articles.title: Selective targeting of NRF2-high pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma with an NQO1-activatable prodrug.
articles.summary: A novel drug C29h selectively targets high-NRF2 pancreatic cancer cells by exploiting their increased NQO1 enzyme levels, leading to tumor regression and improved survival.

articles.title: A cytokine receptor-targeting chimera toolbox for expanding extracellular targeted protein degradation.
articles.summary: Researchers developed 81 new protein-targeting chimeras using cytokine receptors, enabling more precise protein degradation across different cell types.

articles.title: Caspase-3 cleaves and activates the NADase SARM1 to promote apoptosis, linking two cell death mechanisms.
articles.summary: In neuroblastoma and immune cells, caspase-3 activates SARM1 by cleaving its regulatory domain, promoting cell death through NAD+ metabolism.

articles.title: Recent Insights Into Circulating Adipokines in Obesity: Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis.
articles.summary: Research reveals significant variations in adipokine levels in obesity, highlighting complex inflammatory changes in circulating blood proteins associated with metabolic dysfunction.

articles.title: Tumor Immunotherapy and Microbiome: From Bench-to-Bedside Applications.
articles.summary: The microbiome significantly influences cancer immunotherapy effectiveness by modulating immune responses and potentially improving treatment outcomes through specific microbial interactions.

articles.title: Syzygium aromaticum leaf extract promoted biogenic CuO nanoparticles for the anti-apoptotic efficacies of NCI-H661 human lung adenocarcinoma cell line and following the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway.
articles.summary: Syzygium aromaticum leaf-derived copper oxide nanoparticles significantly reduced lung adenocarcinoma cell viability by disrupting cell growth and promoting cancer cell death.

articles.title: MHC one-two punch knocks out cancer.
articles.summary: By combining class I and II immunogenic peptides into a single molecule, researchers developed a powerful approach to enhance cancer immunotherapy's effectiveness.

articles.title: Conference report: current advances in embryo model research at the International Dutch Embryo Model Meeting 2025.
articles.summary:

articles.title: HMGN2 induces pyroptosis in tumour cells by modulating the STT3B/PD‑L1/caspase‑1/GSDMD axis.
articles.summary: HMGN2 protein triggers cell death in CAL-27 oral cancer cells by interacting with STT3B and activating a specific cell destruction pathway.

articles.title: Deciphering the CAF‑LCN2 axis: Key to overcoming anti‑PD‑L1 immunotherapy resistance in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Cancer-associated fibroblasts increase lung cancer's resistance to immunotherapy by elevating LCN2 levels, which can be counteracted by silencing LCN2.

articles.title: Natural compound 5,7,8‑trimethoxyflavone mitigates radiation‑induced lung injury by suppressing EMT and PI3K/Akt pathway.
articles.summary: A natural compound (5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone) reduces lung radiation damage by blocking key cellular pathways and reversing tissue changes in experimental models.

articles.title: Epigenetic dysregulation of B‑cells in autoimmune diseases and lymphomas (Review).
articles.summary: Epigenetic changes in B-cells can contribute to the development of autoimmune diseases and lymphomas by disrupting normal gene expression patterns.

articles.title: Mangiferin in human disease: Multifaceted mechanisms and applications (Review).
articles.summary: Mangiferin, a natural compound, shows promise in suppressing cancer cell growth and inflammation by targeting multiple cellular signaling pathways.

articles.title: HMBOX1 inhibits hepatocellular carcinoma progression via PTPN1 mediated AKT1 phosphorylation.
articles.summary: HMBOX1 protein suppresses liver cancer cell growth and spread by influencing a specific molecular pathway involving PTPN1 and AKT1.

articles.title: GPR176 enhances the epithelial‑mesenchymal transition in gastric cancer cells by activating the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway.
articles.summary: GPR176 promotes gastric cancer cell migration and invasion by activating key signaling pathways, suggesting its potential as a prognostic biomarker.

articles.title: Collaborative breakthroughs in precision diagnosis and treatment of nasopharyngeal cancer: Biomarker‑driven screening and endoscopic minimally invasive surgery reshape the new paradigm of early intervention (Review).
articles.summary: Novel EBV-based screening and minimally invasive endoscopic surgery enable ultra-early detection and precise treatment of nasopharyngeal cancer with 97.9% sensitivity.

articles.title: Secondary causes and renal outcomes in apparently resistant hypertension: a retrospective cohort study.
articles.summary:

articles.title: Smartphone-Enabled Cough Detection in Severely Exacerbated COPD: An Exploratory Pilot Study.
articles.summary: A smartphone app successfully detected cough patterns in COPD patients, potentially enabling early intervention and remote monitoring of disease progression.

articles.title: Leukemia-derived exosomes induce immunosuppression of dendritic cell function via TGFB2-MRPL58 axis.
articles.summary: Leukemia exosomes suppress immune cell function by blocking dendritic cell activity through a specific molecular pathway involving TGFB2 and MRPL58.

articles.title: Clinical effectiveness and impact of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccines in preventing invasive pneumococcal disease among children with risk conditions: A systematic literature review.
articles.summary: PCV13 vaccine showed high effectiveness (83-91%) in preventing invasive pneumococcal disease among children with various immunocompromising conditions like sickle cell disease and cancer.

articles.title: Exogenous indole promotes florfenicol tolerance in Edwardsiella tarda.
articles.summary: Exogenous indole promotes Edwardsiella tarda's tolerance to florfenicol by disrupting metabolism and blocking antibiotic entry in fish bacteria.

articles.title: The P7 peptide antagonizes bFGF-induced malignant behaviors of ovarian cancer by inhibiting MEK/ERK signaling pathway.
articles.summary: P7 peptide blocks basic fibroblast growth factor's ability to promote ovarian cancer cell growth and spread by interrupting a key cell signaling pathway.

articles.title: Machine learning-assisted detection of canine mammary tumors using serum autoantibody signatures.
articles.summary: A machine learning model can detect canine mammary tumors with over 75% accuracy by analyzing specific autoantibody signatures in blood samples.

articles.title: Environmental tobacco smoke exposure and pelvic inflammatory disease: a cross-sectional analysis of serum cotinine.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Non-smoking women exposed to secondhand tobacco smoke showed increased risk of pelvic inflammatory disease, as measured by serum cotinine levels.

articles.title: Elevated C-reactive protein to albumin ratio is a promising predictive biomarker for prognosis in patients with renal cell carcinoma.
articles.summary: In patients with renal cell carcinoma, a high C-reactive protein to albumin ratio may indicate more severe disease and predict worse patient outcomes.

articles.title: Clinical characteristics and whole exome sequencing in JAK2V617F- and CALR-unmutated essential thrombocythemia.
articles.summary: Researchers identified unique genetic mutations in patients with essential thrombocythemia who lack previously known common genetic markers, potentially offering new insights into the disease's underlying mechanisms.

articles.title: Discovery of novel and highly potent XIAP-targeted peptide inhibitors using virtual screening.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered a novel peptide (Peptide-5) that effectively inhibits XIAP protein in lung cancer, potentially blocking tumor growth with minimal harm to normal cells.

articles.title: Engineering nanobodies for drug delivery systems in Alzheimer's disease.
articles.summary: Nanobodies engineered to cross the blood-brain barrier show promise in targeting and reducing amyloid-β and tau pathology in Alzheimer's disease.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds may improve clear cell renal cell carcinoma prognosis by targeting NEK6 and modulating immune cell interactions in the tumor environment.

articles.title: Development and validation of a predictive model for high-risk immune-related adverse events in gastric cancer patients treated with ICIs.
articles.summary: A predictive model for high-risk immune-related adverse events in gastric cancer patients treated with immunotherapy was developed using inflammatory markers and tumor characteristics.

articles.title: Toward next-generation therapeutic HPV vaccines: A review on expanding the antigen repertoire and an integrated bioinformatics selection framework.
articles.summary: A bioinformatics framework for selecting tumor-specific neoantigens could improve therapeutic HPV vaccines by expanding beyond traditional E6/E7 targets.

articles.title: Association between Gushen Antai recipe intervention and plasma cytokines during early pregnancy following IVF-ET: a cohort study.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

A traditional Chinese herbal remedy (Gushen Antai) may improve early pregnancy outcomes after IVF by positively influencing plasma cytokine levels.

articles.title: A tri-scale in silico framework integrating pharmacovigilance and mechanistic modeling suggests tepotinib-associated acute kidney injury risk.
articles.summary: A computational analysis reveals tepotinib, a lung cancer drug, may cause kidney injury by interacting with six key genes involved in cellular stress pathways.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary: In urothelial cancer, manipulating the gut microbiome through transplantation, probiotics, or diet may enhance immunotherapy effectiveness by boosting immune system response.

articles.title: Association between Gushen Antai recipe intervention and plasma cytokines during early pregnancy following IVF-ET: a cohort study.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Herbal treatment Gushen Antai showed potential for improving early pregnancy outcomes in IVF patients by modulating immune system markers.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds target NEK6 in kidney cancer, potentially improving prognosis by influencing immune cell interactions and reducing tumor progression.

articles.title: Antibodies to watch in 2026.
articles.summary: The review tracks the growing antibody therapeutic pipeline, highlighting 209 late-stage candidates with potential regulatory review in 2026, predominantly for non-cancer indications.

articles.title: Force coordination distinguishes epithelial and mesenchymal modes of collective chemotaxis.
articles.summary: Neural crest cells migrate differently in epithelial and mesenchymal states, with distinct supracellular force coordination and traction mechanisms during collective chemotaxis.

articles.title: Natural compound 5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone mitigates radiation-induced lung injury by suppressing EMT and PI3K/Akt pathway.
articles.summary: A natural compound called 5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone effectively reduces lung inflammation and fibrosis after radiation exposure by blocking key cellular signaling pathways.

articles.title: Deciphering the CAF-LCN2 axis: Key to overcoming anti-PD-L1 immunotherapy resistance in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Cancer-associated fibroblasts in lung cancer promote therapy resistance by increasing LCN2 levels, and silencing LCN2 can improve immunotherapy effectiveness.

articles.title: Network toxicology and Mendelian randomization reveal pathogenic factors of monoethyl phthalate-induced thyroid cancer.
articles.summary: Network toxicology and genetic analysis identified five key genes that may explain how monoethyl phthalate exposure could contribute to thyroid cancer development.

articles.title: Caspase-3 cleaves and activates the NADase SARM1 to promote apoptosis, linking two cell death mechanisms.
articles.summary: Caspase-3 activates SARM1, a metabolic enzyme, during cell death in neuroblastoma and immune cells, potentially linking apoptosis and neurodegeneration.

articles.title: Bioresponsive immunomodulator nanocomplex for selective immunoengineering in metastatic lymph nodes.
articles.summary: A targeted nanocomplex selectively reprograms immune responses in metastatic lymph nodes, activating T cells and inhibiting tumor growth in mouse models.

articles.title: Scaling the glassy dynamics of active particles: Tunable fragility and reentrance.
articles.summary: Self-propelled particles in dense assemblies exhibit complex dynamic behaviors that could provide insights into biological processes like cancer progression.

articles.title: Clinical Implications of Aberrant Retinoblastoma Signaling in Patients With Grade 4 IDH-Mutant Astrocytoma: A Retrospective Cohort Study.
articles.summary: A disruption in retinoblastoma cell signaling is linked to shorter survival in patients with grade 4 IDH-mutant brain astrocytoma.

articles.title: Impact of renal and hepatic function on dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase phenotype assessed by enzyme activity in peripheral blood mononuclear cells and uracilemia.
articles.summary: A study found that kidney and liver problems can affect enzyme activity related to how the body processes certain cancer drugs, potentially impacting treatment effectiveness.

articles.title: Glutathione-activatable bola dendrimers mediate tumor-specific cytosolic siRNA delivery via dynamic thiol-disulfide exchange.
articles.summary: Glutathione-responsive bola dendrimers successfully delivered siRNA to lung cancer cells, inhibiting tumor growth with minimal side effects.

articles.title: Protective effect of Rosmarinus officinalis and its nanoparticles against chemobrain and neuroinflammation in rats: involvement of Wnt/β-catenin signaling and apoptotic machineries.
articles.summary: Rosmarinus officinalis extract and nanoemulsion protected rats from oxaliplatin-induced chemobrain by reducing neuroinflammation and preserving cognitive function.

articles.title: [Evaluation of long-term prognosis of gastric cancer patients by tumor textbook outcome and analysis of related factors].
articles.summary: In gastric cancer patients, achieving textbook oncologic outcome (TOO) after surgery was associated with significantly better long-term survival rates.

articles.title: Discovery of a Covalent Small-Molecule eEF1A1 Inhibitor via Structure-Based Virtual Screening.
articles.summary: A novel small molecule inhibitor (AKOS-04) targeting the protein eEF1A1 shows promising potential for pancreatic cancer treatment through covalent binding.

articles.title: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene suppresses prostate cancer via apoptosis and autophagy in vitro and potent tumor growth inhibition in vivo.
articles.summary: 3'-Hydroxypterostilbene effectively suppresses prostate cancer by inducing cancer cell death through coordinated apoptosis and autophagy mechanisms.

articles.title: Lactobacillus fermentum remodeled the lung microbiota by crosstalk with the gut and lungs and regulated the PI3K-AKT pathway to alleviate acute lung injury.
articles.summary: Lactobacillus fermentum reduced lung inflammation and injury by rebalancing gut and lung microbiota and suppressing a key inflammatory pathway.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

Specific gut microbiome compositions can enhance immune checkpoint inhibitor effectiveness in urothelial carcinoma by improving immune system response.

articles.title: Association between Gushen Antai recipe intervention and plasma cytokines during early pregnancy following IVF-ET: a cohort study.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

A traditional Chinese herbal medicine called Gushen Antai recipe may help improve pregnancy success rates for women undergoing IVF by modulating immune system responses.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds target NEK6 in kidney cancer, potentially improving prognosis by modulating immune cell interactions and reducing tumor aggression.

articles.title: Antibodies to watch in 2026.
articles.summary: Researchers tracked the growth of antibody therapeutics in development, noting significant expansion from 26 to over 200 late-stage candidates across various medical indications.

articles.title: Force coordination distinguishes epithelial and mesenchymal modes of collective chemotaxis.
articles.summary: Mesenchymal and epithelial neural crest cell clusters use different force coordination mechanisms to migrate collectively toward a chemical signal.

articles.title: Natural compound 5,7,8‑trimethoxyflavone mitigates radiation‑induced lung injury by suppressing EMT and PI3K/Akt pathway.
articles.summary: A natural compound 5,7,8-trimethoxyflavone reduces lung inflammation and fibrosis after radiation by blocking key cellular transformation pathways.

articles.title: Deciphering the CAF‑LCN2 axis: Key to overcoming anti‑PD‑L1 immunotherapy resistance in lung cancer.
articles.summary: Cancer-associated fibroblasts regulate lipocalin 2 expression, promoting lung cancer resistance to immunotherapy and suggesting a potential targeted treatment approach.

articles.title: Network toxicology and Mendelian randomization reveal pathogenic factors of monoethyl phthalate-induced thyroid cancer.
articles.summary: Researchers identified 10 genes, particularly ESR1 and SKP2, that may mediate monoethyl phthalate's role in causing thyroid cancer through molecular and genetic analysis.

articles.title: Caspase-3 cleaves and activates the NADase SARM1 to promote apoptosis, linking two cell death mechanisms.
articles.summary: In neuroblastoma and immune cells, caspase-3 activates SARM1, a protein that promotes cell death by breaking down NAD+ during apoptosis.

articles.title: Bioresponsive immunomodulator nanocomplex for selective immunoengineering in metastatic lymph nodes.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

A targeted nanocomplex selectively activates T-cell responses in metastatic lymph nodes, effectively inhibiting tumor growth and improving survival.

articles.title: Scaling the glassy dynamics of active particles: Tunable fragility and reentrance.
articles.summary: Research shows how self-propelled particles in dense systems can alter glass-like dynamics, potentially offering insights into complex biological processes like cancer progression.

articles.title: Clinical Implications of Aberrant Retinoblastoma Signaling in Patients With Grade 4 IDH-Mutant Astrocytoma: A Retrospective Cohort Study.
articles.summary: Grade 4 IDH-mutant astrocytoma patients with disrupted retinoblastoma signaling showed significantly worse survival outcomes compared to patients with intact signaling.

articles.title: Impact of renal and hepatic function on dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase phenotype assessed by enzyme activity in peripheral blood mononuclear cells and uracilemia.
articles.summary: Researchers found that kidney and liver function significantly affect how the body processes certain cancer treatment drugs by altering enzyme activity and uracil levels in blood cells.

articles.title: Glutathione-activatable bola dendrimers mediate tumor-specific cytosolic siRNA delivery via dynamic thiol-disulfide exchange.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Researchers developed a novel dendrimer that delivers RNA interference therapy specifically to lung cancer cells by exploiting tumor-specific chemical interactions.
